modName: Halloween In Solitude - Lots of Pumpkins
summary: The townsfolk of Solitude have grown a bumper crop of pumpkins, and now the streets are filled with carved, lit jack-o-lanterns.  This mod adds more than 100 pumpkins, both carved and un-carved, to the city of Solitude.  No interior locations were changed.
descriptionHtml:
[size=6][color=#FF8000][b]Check out the updated version, Halloween in Skyrim - Even More Pumpkins![/b][/color][/size]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/44654]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/44654[/url]

[size=5][color=#FF8000][b]Halloween In Solitude - Lots of Pumpkins[/b][/color][/size]
The townsfolk of Solitude have grown a bumper crop of pumpkins, and now the streets are filled with carved, lit jack-o-lanterns. This mod adds more than 100 pumpkins, both carved and un-carved, to the city of Solitude. No interior locations were changed.

This mod is strictly cosmetic. You can't move/eat/throw the pumpkins, and I have placed them in out-of-the-way corners and on walls so that they hopefully will not be an obstruction for any of the townsfolk.

[size=4][color=#FF8000][b]Installation Instructions[/b][/color][/size]
If you're installing this by hand, then extract all files into Skyrim's Data folder (for me, that's under C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\skyrim\Data). If you already have existing meshes and textures folders, click Yes or Yes to All when it prompts you whether you want to copy the files into them.

Once you unpack the files, verify that the mod is activated by selecting "Data Files" from the loader screen, and ensuring that "HalloweenInSolitude.esp" is checked.

You will have to disable this mod to make the pumpkins go away after Halloween.

[size=4][color=#FF8000][b]Credits[/b][/color][/size]
This mod was created by Deandra at the UESP (username Merilia at TESNexus since the name Deandra was taken). The pumpkins are based on a mesh and texture by Yughues aka Nobiax, which was packaged in a modder's resource by Tamira in her [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22018]New Plants 1_1[/url]. Please make sure to give credit to all of the people who have put work into these files if you choose to use them in a mod of your own, and respect their rights.

[size=4][color=#FF8000][b]Video[/b][/color][/size]
Thanks to Saiodin, Preykousis, Svaalbard and Brodual for featuring this mod in their YouTube videos!
